name: Transient Global Amnesia
chief_complaint: I can't remember anything that happened today, and I keep asking the same questions over and over.
physical_findings: Normal cognitive function except for amnesia
prognosis: Excellent, with full recovery typically within 24 hours and no recurrence in most cases
description: Transient Global Amnesia is a sudden, temporary episode of memory loss that can't be attributed to a more common neurological condition, such as epilepsy or stroke. During an episode, the patient retains personal identity but is unable to form new memories or recall recent events. The exact cause is unknown, but it may be related to temporary disruption of blood flow or neuronal activity in memory-related brain areas.
